bibl.title: Letter from George [s.n.] to Philip Showalter Hench, October 20, 1940

div1.p: George sends Hench his congratulations and regrets that he will not be able to attend the Washington and Jefferson College ceremony. In the postscript, he offers a brief political statement.

div1.head: Letter from George [s.n.] to Philip Showalter Hench, October 20, 1940
div1.opener:
NORTHERN INDIANA BRASS CO.
ROSS MARTIN, President
TRADE MARK
NIBCO
MDG. PAT. OFF.
BRONZE VALVES
COPPER FITTINGS
ELKHART, INDIANA.
Sunday Oct. 20, 1940.
Dear Phil:
div1.p:
I guess congratulations are in order
once again & we are only sorry that we can't
be with you this time. I so happens that I
expect to be in Pgh. Nov. 1st & if W. & J. could
possibly change the date we most certainly would be
there. Tell Aunt Clora we will try & get in to see
her this time as we will be there for several
days. My new job is going along in fine shape
& I like it very much. If you ever get down in
this direction don't forget to let us know.
With best wishes & hoping you get a lot more
degrees & thanks for remembering us. Love from
Nadine & I to Mary, the kids, & Mrs. Kahler
